means: （尤指最近）改变宗教信仰[政治信仰、意见等]的人，改入他党者

sentence.Network_en: I am very cuious about why you come to Taiwan to proselyte.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很好奇你们为什麽来台湾传教.

sentence.Network_en: The governments of some countries forbid us to proselyte.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些国家的政府禁止我们传教.

sentence.Network_en: The General Authorities are in the process of negotiating with governments, hoping we can proselyte.
sentence.Network_cn: 总会当局正在交涉, 希望政府让我们传教.

「入教」(proselyte)是指一些外邦人到会堂改信犹太教者。通常要受了割礼以后才算是真正入教，也必需遵守律法。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via late Latin from Greek prosēluthos 'stranger, convert', from prosēluth-, past stem of proserkhesthai 'approach'

means.word_mean: 1. a new convert; especially a gentile converted to Judaism
